message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to this survey as a primary or secondary school teacher from Vietnam. I should provide thoughtful responses about AI in education based on realistic perspectives a teacher might have.

Let me think through each statement:

TT4G35A - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.
This is generally true - AI can help with planning. I would say "Agree" as this is a positive use case.

TT4G35B - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.
This is a realistic capability of AI - personalization. I would say "Agree".

TT4G35C - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually.
This is true - AI can provide personalized support. I would say "Agree".

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs.
This is a positive application. "Agree" seems appropriate.

TT4G35E - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks.
This is definitely true and a major benefit. "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Strongly agree" as this is well-established.

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.
This is a negative impact and real concern (e.g., using AI to generate homework, plagiarism concerns). As a teacher, I would be concerned about this. "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Strongly agree" as this is a genuine concern.

TT4G35G - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.
This is true - AI can make mistakes or inappropriate suggestions. "Agree" seems appropriate.

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.
This is a known concern with AI systems. "Agree" seems reasonable.

TT4G35I - AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.
This is a significant concern - data privacy with AI systems. "Agree" seems reasonable for this concern.


TT4G35J - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.
This is another concern worth considering - AI might recommend teaching methods that don't align with sound educational practice. "Agree" captures this worry appropriately.

I should aim to give balanced responses that acknowledge both the genuine benefits AI offers in education and the legitimate concerns teachers face when implementing it.
